did.abstract: Consists of records of the Pennsylvania Militia, primarily during the War of 1812.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection includes the correspondence, spanning the years 1814 to 1821, of Isaac Morrell, the Major General in 1815 and recorder of the County of Philadelphia in 1819-1821. The 1815 letters concern the payment of troops, while those between 1819 and 1821 refer to commissions to be recorded. The collection also includes estimates of pay, subsistence, forage, and clothing of regiments of militia, light infantry, and volunteers attached to the 2nd and 3rd brigades of Pennsylvania militia from September 1814 to January 1815 and payrolls of companies in the 1st regiment, 1st brigade, 2nd division, the 2nd regiment, and the 32nd regiment of Pennsylvania militia, September - December 1814.
For digitized content, see Digital Collections.
